snippet: A veteran coach in New Jersey believes coaches need to keep a close watch on their players and teach them to trust and protect one another.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column contends crisis at New Jersey's Sayreville High School, with seven football players arrested on charges including sexual assault and hazing of four freshmen in locker room, is failure of coaches, administrators and even parents; argues that breakdown of system on high school level can help explain how bullies in pro football locker rooms, like Richie Incognito, could exist.
lead_paragraph: A veteran coach in New Jersey believes coaches need to keep a close watch on their players and teach them to trust and protect one another.

headline.main: Searching for Adult Supervision in Sayreville
headline.print_headline: Searching for Adult Supervision in Sayreville

keywords.value: Sayreville War Memorial High School (Sayreville, NJ)
